Nature
You are my wife. Therefore, out of my immense love for you, I have, in return, acquired a house in the taluk of Gauvaram village, R.S. No. 262, on the land where my ancestral property, which was acquired by my family members before 1983, came as part of the distribution of family property, and I have acquired a house with my own money, R.S. No. 262, 0.06 cents, 500 sq. The house situated at Lim.lu, my name is Govaram, registered in the records of the Gram Panchayat as Doro No. 2-69, Assessment No. 269, which is in my possession till today, with all full rights and privileges, and which has been subjected to any other encumbrances, is hereby acquired by you as per the schedule below, for a value of Rs. 9,68,000/- in characters, as a real estate. You and I are the sole owners of this property and you are the sole beneficiaries and no one else has any rights over it. If you take possession of the property as per the schedule below and enjoy all the rights of our exchange and sale according to your will, then neither I nor my heirs nor your heirs will be able to make any claim or dispute against you or your heirs. Since it is my main purpose to transfer this settlement property to you and since I have transferred it to you without any prejudice, I can cancel this settlement at any time. If there are any disputes regarding this settlement, I will be able to avoid them all at my own expense and pay your right and your debt without delay. Declaration
That the particulars set forth in this document are true and correct as per Section 27 of the Indian Stamp Act and that all moneys due and payable in respect of the same, if any, in respect of the same, shall be transferred in lieu of prosecution as per Section 64 of the Indian Stamp Act I hereby declare that the property does not contain any trees or gardens like mango, coconut, betel, sweet potato etc. or any valuable minerals, mines, precious stone quarries like granite etc., missionary, fish ponds, buildings etc. and I hereby agree to be prosecuted and liable for the payment of depreciation duty if any such facts are found to have been concealed in this deed. The Scheduled Property Ordinance 2/77 is not assigned. I, my heirs and assigns, are bound by these terms. This is my signed settlement deed.
Annexure III
"I, hereby declare that the property mentioned in the document belongs to me and was
not alienated earlier and if it is found to have been violated the provisions of Section
22B of Registration Act, 1908, I would be Liable for penal action as per Section 82 of
Registration Act, 1908".
Guji Arjuna Rashtra

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 481 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Gunji Arjunarao in favour of His Wife, Gunji Nagamma, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 314.6 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 2-69, Assessment number 269, comprised in survey number 262, situated in Gowravaram Village, Jaggayyapeta Mandal, within the District of NTR, registered at sub-registrar office Nandigama (619) is bounded as follows: North by: House Of Thammisetti Srinu South by: House Of Gunji Tirupatamma East by: Grampanchayat Road West by: Vacant Site Of Thammisetti Konda.
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.
The EC has been verified and downloaded using the document number parameter, as the option to retrieve EC records using the property address is currently unavailable in the Online EC portal.
